findings.title: Harvesting Potential Front-Run
findings.description: The `harvest()` function has no limitations on caller identifier and lacks a 'commit and reveal' scheme or other mechanisms to prevent front-running, allowing an attacker to disrupt transaction execution.

findings.title: Potentially Null Swap Destination Address
findings.description: The `_swapUniswap` function has a possibility to swap tokens with `UniswapRouterV2` to `address(0)` destination.

findings.title: Non-Null Addresses
findings.description: Checking if an address-typed argument is not 0, it is recommended to implement additional requires in contract constructor, checking if each of input arguments != address(0), to avoid potential issues in newcoming contract updates.

findings.title: Redundant memory allocation for asset index type
findings.description: The `getMostPremium()` function returns a tuple containing an unnecessarily huge asset index type `uint256`, which can be reduced to a smaller type like `uint8`.
